title: Israel, Islamic Jihad, say Gaza ceasefire agreement reached
description: Israel says an agreement to restore a ceasefire for Gaza will come into effect at 11:30 p.m. local time (4:30 p.m. ET), following up a similar announcement from Islamic Jihad a short while earlier.

title: Boy at center of UK court battle dies after life support withdrawn
description: Archie Battersbee, a 12-year-old British boy, at the center of a long legal battle between his parents and doctors over the withdrawal of his treatment, died on Saturday, his mother Hollie Dance said.

title: Hundreds of Haitian and Cuban migrants in custody after landing on or near Florida coast, US official says
description: Hundreds of Haitian and Cuban migrants using 16 different vessels were taken into custody after making landfall or reaching the US coast off Florida from Friday to Saturday, US Customs and Border Patrol said.

title: US Senate Democrats pass sweeping health care and climate bill
description: The Senate is continuing to work Sunday on a series of amendment votes but faced a new hiccup early afternoon as Democrats look to pass their sweeping climate, health care and tax package.

title: Albuquerque police are asking the public to share photos, videos that may help the investigation into the killings of 4 Muslim men
America's strong dollar is hurting everyone else
description: The US dollar has been on a tear this year. That's good news for American tourists gallivanting around Europe, but bad news for pretty much every other country in the world.

title: China launches long-range airstrike drills around Taiwan on fourth day of military exercises
description: Chinese forces took part in drills focused on land attacks and long-range airstrikes around Taiwan on Sunday, its military said, on what was expected to be the final day of extensive exercises rolled out in response to a visit to the island by US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.

title: Video captures oil tank exploding into massive fireball
description: Lightning struck an oil storage facility tank outside of Havana, Cuba causing raging fires that ignited a second tank explosion nearby.

title: UN's nuclear watchdog warns of 'disaster' at Ukraine power plant as shelling continues
description: The world's nuclear watchdog has called for an immediate cessation of hostilities near Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in southern Ukraine after it was struck by shelling, triggering the shutdown of one of the reactors and signaling the "real risk of a nuclear disaster."

title: Stacey Abrams explains why she was 'anti-abortion' until she went to college
description: Georgia Democratic gubernatorial nominee Stacey Abrams said Sunday that she was "anti-abortion" until she went to college and met a friend who gave her a new perspective on the contentious issue.

title: Breyer, in first appearance since Roe v. Wade was overturned, says 'I'm still an optimist'
description: Justice Stephen Breyer made sure Saturday night to steer clear of any controversy in his first public appearance since he retired and the Supreme Court's conservative majority overturned Roe v. Wade.

title: 'You are not a refugee.' Roma refugees fleeing war in Ukraine say they are suffering discrimination and prejudice
description: Luiza Baloh left her home in Dnipro, central Ukraine, in March. Fleeing the constant sound of explosions, she and her five children came to the Czech Republic hoping to find refuge.

title: Top Republican has message for Trump if he runs in 2024
description: While on State of the Union with CNN's Dana Bash, Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) sends a message directly to former President Donald Trump about another possible bid for the White House in 2024.

title: Senators put pressure on Biden to designate Russia a state sponsor of terror
description: A bipartisan pair of senators has called on the Biden administration to designate Russia as a state sponsor of terrorism in response to its invasion of Ukraine, saying they would push Congress to pass a bill issuing the designation "whether or not" it had President Joe Biden's support.

title: Tiffany's sells out custom Cryptopunk 'NFTiff' pendants for $50,000 each
description: On Friday, Tiffany & Co debuted and quickly sold out a limited collection of 250 custom jewel-encrusted pendants for holders of CryptoPunks, a popular early non-fungible token collection.

title: More human remains discovered in Lake Mead's receding waters
description: More human remains have been found in the receding waters of Lake Mead, authorities announced Saturday.

title: How to adapt Jane Austen -- and why it's so hard to get right
description: It's an act braver than marrying for love, riskier than running away with Mr. Wickham and plainer than Anne Elliot to adapt Jane Austen's beloved, essential books for the screen.

title: The market read the Federal Reserve all wrong
description: After the Federal Reserve's July meeting, investors quickly reached a consensus: The central bank was turning slightly dovish.

title: Nebraska and Colorado are sparring over water rights. It could be the new norm as rivers dry up
description: Residents on this state line have built their industry, economy and lives around the South Platte River. But as an intense and widespread drought digs into the High Plains, flows have decreased.

title: Donald Trump's grip on the GOP is still strong
Lionel Messi scores acrobatic bicycle kick as PSG thrashes Clermont in season-opener
description: Lionel Messi scored a sensational bicycle kick to round off Paris Saint-Germain's 5-0 rout of Clermont in its first match of the new Ligue 1 season on Saturday.

title: Families of Kansas' cold case victims find new hope for answers from an unexpected source -- the state's prisoners
description: James Winston was always immaculately dressed. Since he was 10 years old, he would carefully iron his clothes, right down to his socks and underwear. He would later do the same for his kids, making sure they were coordinated from head to toe.

title: Netflix is not in deep trouble. It's becoming a media company
description: Netflix has had a terrible 2022. In April, it said it lost subscribers for the first time since 2011. Its stock has tumbled more than 60% so far this year.

title: Covid lockdown strands thousands of tourists in 'China's Hawaii'
description: Around 80,000 tourists are stranded in the popular resort city of Sanya on China's tropical Hainan island after authorities announced lockdown measures to stem an outbreak of Covid-19.

title: He was shot and killed playing the sport he loved. Now this Ohio 15-year-old is one of the country's latest victims of gun violence
description: Ali Jeylani knows you shouldn't pick favorites when it comes to family members, but of his seven siblings, he's always had a soft spot for his younger brother, Issa.

title: A centuries-old horse tooth might be the last piece in the genetic puzzle of Assateague's horses
description: The unexpected discovery of a 16th-century horse tooth in modern-day Haiti has provided credence for an age-old folk story about the origin of feral horses on an island off Maryland and Virginia.

title: Airlines cancel more than 600 US flights and delay thousands more Saturday
description: More than 600 flights were canceled and thousands more were delayed in the United States on Saturday, according to the flight tracking website FlightAware.

title: US Secret Service providing personal cell phone numbers of agents to oversight entities
description: Personal cell phone numbers of US Secret Service agents have been provided to oversight bodies looking into the January 6, 2021 attack on the US Capitol.

title: Leading Taiwanese weapons developer found dead in hotel room
description: The deputy head of Taiwan's government-controlled weapons developer has died after suffering a heart attack on a trip to the south of the island.

title: US will defend Philippines if attacked in South China Sea: Blinken
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken assured the Philippines on Saturday that the United States would come to its defense if attacked in the South China Sea, seeking to allay concerns about the extent of the US commitment to a mutual defense treaty.
